Getting Started

December 2013

This basic documentation should help you getting started with the code that can be found on GitHub.

Source Tree Overview

All relevant source files can be found within the src/ directory.

Benchmarks: src/benchmark/

benchmark/prodcon/
A producer/consumer based benchmark.
benchmark/bfs/
A breadth first search benchmark using a single work queue to operate on a graph.
benchmark/std_glue/
Each data structure comes with a glue files that specifies how to perform operations of the benchmark on the data structure. (Originally scal was coded in C, leaving still some bits and pieces behind.)

Data Structures: src/datastructures/

Holds all (!) data structures as .h includes. This is necessary because all of them make use of C++ generics (templates).

An example:

The well-known Michael-Scott queue can be found in src/datastructures/ms_queue.h.

Framework: src/util/

Most (if not all) of the actual framework stuff, like atomics, a scalable relaxed allocator, or threadlocal storage can be found in here.
